The higher deployment in 2°C scenarios cannot be explained solely as a result of
dynamics. In IAMs, technology deployment is also governed by system constraints that characterize
both scenarios, e.g. the flexibility of the energy system, the availability of storage technologies. From a
ing more stringent climate policies to meet the 2°C targets forces
models to find solutions, even if costly, to meet those intermittency and flexibility constraints and
